channel.title: math.GT updates on arXiv.org
channel.description: math.GT updates on the arXiv.org e-print archive.

item.title: On Hecke lifting conjecture for framed knots
item.description: arXiv:2510.15692v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Motivated by an amazing integrality structure conjecture for the $U(N)$ Chern-Simons quantum invariants of framed knots investigated by Mari\~no and Vafa, a new conjectural formula, named Hecke lifting conjecture, was proposed in \cite{CLPZ23} for framed links. This note is devoted to the study of this Hecke lifting conjecture. We prove this conjecture for torus knots using the explicit formulas of colored HOMFLY-PT invariants of torus knots, and we also verify the conjecture in a limit form for any framed knots.
item.dc:creator: Shengmao Zhu

item.title: Partially hyperbolic diffeormorphisms, ergodicity, and transverse foliations in dimension 3
item.description: arXiv:2510.15176v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: We give a complete topological classification of transitive partially hyperbolic diffeomorphisms in 3-manifolds in terms of Anosov flows, completing a program proposed by Pujals. In particular, this also allows to give a full answer to the ergodicity conjecture of Hertz-Hertz-Ures for partially hyperbolic diffeomorphisms in dimension 3. This is achieved by showing a general result about pairs of transverse $2$-dimensional foliations in 3-manifolds with Gromov hyperbolic leaves which may be of independent interest.
item.dc:creator: S. R. Fenley, R. Potrie

item.title: Topological invariance of Liouville structures for taut foliations and Anosov flows
item.description: arXiv:2510.15325v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: Building on the work of Eliashberg and Thurston, we associate to a taut foliation on a closed oriented $3$-manifold $M$ a Liouville structure on the thickening $[-1,1] \times M$, under suitable hypotheses. Our main result shows that this Liouville structure is a topological invariant of the foliation: two such foliations which are topologically conjugated induce exact symplectomorphic Liouville structures. Specializing to the case of weak foliations of Anosov flows, we obtain that under natural orientability conditions, the Liouville structures originally introduced by Mitsumatsu are invariant under orbit equivalence. Our methods also imply that two orbit equivalent Anosov flows are deformation equivalent through projectively Anosov flows. The proofs combine two main technical ingredients: (1) a careful smoothing scheme for topological conjugacies between $C^1$-foliations, and (2) a refinement of a deep result of Vogel on the uniqueness of contact structures approximating a foliation. In an appendix, this smoothing scheme is used to construct new examples of collapsed Anosov flows, providing a key step to complete the classification of transitive partially hyperbolic diffeomorphisms in dimension three.
item.dc:creator: Jonathan Bowden, Thomas Massoni

item.title: On the domination of surface-group representations in $\mathrm{PU}(2,1)$
item.description: arXiv:2506.03838v2 Announce Type: replace Abstract: This article explores surface-group representations into the complex hyperbolic group $\mathrm{PU}(2,1)$ and presents domination results for a special class of representations called $T$-bent representations. Let $S_{g,k}$ be a punctured surface of negative Euler characteristic. We prove that for a $T$-bent representation $\rho: \pi_1(S_{g,k}) \rightarrow \mathrm{PU}(2,1)$, there exists a discrete and faithful representation $\rho_0: \pi_1(S_{g,k}) \rightarrow \mathrm{PO}(2,1)$ that dominates $\rho$ in the Bergman translation length spectrum, while preserving the lengths of the peripheral loops.
item.dc:creator: Pabitra Barman, Krishnendu Gongopadhyay

item.title: Extending knot polynomials of braided Hopf algebras to links
item.description: arXiv:2505.01398v2 Announce Type: replace-cross Abstract: Recently, a plethora of multivariable knot polynomials were introduced by Kashaev and one of the authors, by applying the Reshetikhin-Turaev functor to rigid $R$-matrices that come for braided Hopf algebras with automorphisms. We study the extension of these knot invariants to links, and use this to identify some of them with known link invariants, as conjectured in that same recent work.
item.dc:creator: Stavros Garoufalidis, Matthew Harper, Ben-Michael Kohli, Jiebo Song, Guillaume Tahar
